summary: This is an FBI administrative document from the New York field office, dated October 6, 2021, regarding a delayed response to an additional inquiry. It references the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services and indicates that records can be obtained through the Interstate Identification Index using NCIC transactions.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: He is listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, which is the agency being corresponded with by the FBI regarding record access.

events.title: FBI Delayed Response Inquiry
events.description: The FBI New York field office sends a delayed response regarding an additional inquiry about obtaining records through the Interstate Identification Index.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St. Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: The document is dated October 6, 2021, showing ongoing administrative activity related to the Epstein case years after his death.
It involves the FBI New York field office and the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.
The document indicates that records can be obtained through the Interstate Identification Index (III) using NCIC transactions, suggesting a process for accessing criminal history information.
Michael C. Green is identified as the Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services.
